intro: Cinchona peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian bark, is a species of tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and yellow flowers. The plant is renowned for its production of quinine, a compound historically used to treat malaria. Its bark contains alkaloids that have been valued for their medicinal properties for centuries. Cinchona peruviana thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes.
